text: Morning peoples, I'm hitting the job market. I've just done 18 months of a big node project (rewriting the Times website, making an API for it and the apps, bolting a graph query layer on top of Elasticsearch, which was ... interesting), and backend-wise I've also done Django and Rails stuff. Ideally I'd like a job where I wasn't *only* writing Javascript. I'm currently obsessed with FP, especially Elixir and Clojure. I also know a bit of devops-y stuff (mostly just orchestrating EC2 boxes with cloudformation). I would gratefully receive any leads in a DM or at <mailto:jamesturley1905@googlemail.com|jamesturley1905@googlemail.com>. Thanks!
<@U06BGNMBL>: are you looking for short contracts, long contracts, full time, all of the above?
Full time and possibly long contracts, although I don't currently have a company set up or anything like that
<@U06BGNMBL>: setting up an ltd is really quick nowadays
although I’ve never contracted before…I think you need a hand from an accountant
if you do, let me refer you to crunch
#spam
In the short term I could become an employee of my brother who has an IT project management thing going
I did that before with some really shady SEO freelancing work which is not on my CV :simple_smile:
but yeah, I hear it's not much of a faff nowadays
I registered as a sole trader to do freelance work
and never got an accountant
and live in blissful ignorance of how much money I could/should have on income tax
though I do use <http://freeagent.com|freeagent.com>
<@U03V8V08M>: there’s a repo on github on how to go contracting
I think you could apply those legal mechanisms to ad-hoc freelance work
<https://github.com/tadast/switching-to-contracting-uk/blob/master/README.md>

text: that’s a very good guide :simple_smile:
I use crunch too, pretty easy
and I used formations factory to set up my company

in my 1.5 years of contracting I did precisely none of those things :simple_smile:
#hashtag pro
<@U047GTU64>: thanks for reminding me of that, I can never find it when I need to daydream about writing "£600/day" on a piece of paper and expecting somebody else to actually sign it
£700/day w/lunch included
requires loft in canary wharf
:joy:
:money_with_wings:
600£/day is something I’d like to see
but I haven't
really? I think I’ve seen it about 2 times

ah, yes, I saw it
but not entering my bank
which defeats the point for me
